In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function takes a dataframe `df` as input and adds a new column `ym` to it. The values in this new column are calculated by mapping over the `dt` column of the dataframe, extracting the year and month from each DateTime value, and then concatenating them together into an integer format "yyyymm".

You can use this function like so:
```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 29), DateTime(2023, 3, 31)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will return:
```julia
|    | dt                   | ym      |
|----|----------------------|---------|
| 1  | 2021-01-01T00:00:00 | 202101 |
| 2  | 2022-02-29T00:00:00 | 202202 |
| 3  | 2023-03-31T00:00:00 | 202303 |
```
